input: DOCTOR: What brings you in today?\nPATIENT: Well, I guess I really didn’t think much of it at first, but then suddenly my eye went really blurry, and I started feeling this dull ache around my head and temples, and it’s been bothering me pretty much all the time now. I’ve also been having a hard time swallowing and feeling kind of feverish off and on, but I don’t really know what’s going on.
output:
THINKING: The patient has now reported new symptoms of blurry vision, dull headache around the head and temples, difficulty swallowing, and intermittent feeling feverish, which were not previously mentioned. These are confirmed and added to the existing vignette. 

ANSWER: The patient reports blurry vision, a dull ache around the head and temples, difficulty swallowing, and occasional feverish feeling.

input:
DOCTOR: What brings you in today?
PATIENT: Well, I guess I really didn’t think much of it at first, but then suddenly my eye went really blurry, and I started feeling this dull ache around my head and temples, and it’s been bothering me pretty much all the time now. I’ve also been having a hard time swallowing and feeling kind of feverish off and on, but I don’t really know what’s going on.
DOCTOR: Can you tell me more about when your symptoms started, how they've changed over time, and if you've noticed anything that makes them better or worse?
PATIENT: Um, the vision thing just kind of came on all of a sudden, like one day I was fine and then suddenly I couldn’t see very well with that eye. The pain around my temples has been there off and on, and I feel like it’s worse when I try to move my head or if I stay in one position too long. I don’t think anything really makes it better, and it doesn’t seem to get better on its own, no.
output:
THINKING: The patient has introduced new symptoms of blurry vision, dull headache around the head and temples, difficulty swallowing, and feeling feverish off and on, which were not previously mentioned. These confirmed symptoms will be added to the existing vignette.  
ANSWER: The patient reports blurry vision, a dull ache around the head and temples, difficulty swallowing, and occasional feverish feeling.

input:
DOCTOR: What brings you in today?
PATIENT: Well, I guess I really didn’t think much of it at first, but then suddenly my eye went really blurry, and I started feeling this dull ache around my head and temples, and it’s been bothering me pretty much all the time now. I’ve also been having a hard time swallowing and feeling kind of feverish off and on, but I don’t really know what’s going on.
DOCTOR: Can you tell me more about when your symptoms started, how they've changed over time, and if you've noticed anything that makes them better or worse?
PATIENT: Um, the vision thing just kind of came on all of a sudden, like one day I was fine and then suddenly I couldn’t see very well with that eye. The pain around my temples has been there off and on, and I feel like it’s worse when I try to move my head or if I stay in one position too long. I don’t think anything really makes it better, and it doesn’t seem to get better on its own, no.
DOCTOR: Can you tell me more about how your symptoms have been affecting your daily activities, and if you've noticed any other changes or symptoms that you've not yet mentioned?
PATIENT: Well, I guess it’s been kind of hard to do things like I used to. My vision problems make it hard to see clearly, and I feel a bit all over the place with my strength sometimes. I’ve also been feeling more tired than usual, and I think I’ve been a bit colder or maybe just achier overall. I just— I don’t know, everything’s been a bit confusing and it’s kinda scary not knowing what’s going on.
output:
THINKING: The latest dialogue introduces new clinical details such as difficulty swallowing, feeling feverish off and on, increased fatigue, feeling colder or achier, and a sense of confusion. These details should be added to the existing vignette to create a comprehensive picture.  
ANSWER: The patient reports blurry vision, a dull ache around the head and temples, difficulty swallowing, occasional feverish feelings, increased fatigue, feeling colder or achier overall, and a sense of confusion.
